name: Parrotfeather

Identifying Characteristics: Submersed and emergent feather divided aquatic plant
Stems: sturdy, sparsely branched, up to 2m long, 5mm diameter
Leaves: vibrant green, slender feather divided (2.5 â€“ 5 cm long), 10-18 leaflet pairs, arranged in whorls of 4-6, flat midrib, internodal space 1cm or more
Flowers: spring and/or fall, tiny white, found in leaf axils of emergent stems
Fruits/Seeds: only female plants in North America so no fruits produced
Biology: Reproduction by seed rare outside native range
Habitat: Tolerates water with some salt intrusion
Range: Northeast US Range: New York, Rhode Island

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
